div.l: Her capil cacche he ran alwey so faste
Til in A diche þey cauȝte him at þe laste
Wery and weet as bestis in the rayn̄
Comyth seli Iohn and wᵗith him Aleyn̄
Allas quod Iohn þe day þat I was born̄
Now are we dryven to hething ⁊and to scorn̄
Our corn is stole men wil vs folis calle
Bothe þe wardeyn and our felowis alle
And nameli þe myller welawey
Thus pleyneth Iohn as he goth be þe wey
Toward þe mylle and bayard in his hond
The myller sitting be þe fire he fond
For it was nyȝt ⁊and ferther myȝte þey nouȝt
But for þe loue of god þey him besouȝt
Of harbarow ⁊and of ese as for hir peny
The myller saide agayn if þer be eny
Such as hit is ȝit shulle ye haue your part
Myn hous is strait but ye haue lernyd art
Ye can be argumentis maken a place
A myle brood of xxᵗⁱ foot of space
Let se now if þis place wol suffize
Or make yt romer wᵗith speche as is yoᵘur gise
Now Symond said this Iohn be saint Cutberd
Ay is thow mery and þat is wel answerd
I haue herd say þᵗat men shal take of swa þingꝭis
Swilk as he fyndis or swilk as he bryngis
But specialli y pray þe ost so dere
Gete vs som mete ⁊and drynke ⁊and make vs chere
And we wol trewli at þe fulle
With empti hondis men may not hawkꝭis telle
Lo here my siluer redy forto spende
This myller to þe toun his douȝter sende
For ale and breed ⁊and rostid hem a goos
And bond her hors þat he sholde nomore go loos
And in his owen chamber he made A bed
